body:
Yep. It didn't quite make any sense and was not used. 
What it used to do: sample `Bernoulli` according to each value in `p`. It doesn't have anything to do with `self`!!!
So it makes much more sense to just call `torch.bernoulli(p)` instead.
body_html:

What it used to do: sample Bernoulli according to each value in p. It doesn't have anything to do with self!!!
So it makes much more sense to just call torch.bernoulli(p) instead.
body_text:
Yep. It didn't quite make any sense and was not used.
What it used to do: sample Bernoulli according to each value in p. It doesn't have anything to do with self!!!
So it makes much more sense to just call torch.bernoulli(p) instead.
